subject: RE: [junit] Member variables become null between tests?
msgSnippet: Ramanand Hegde said... ... Each test runs in its own instance of your test class, so the second test runs in a completely different instance of your class
messageBody:
Ramanand Hegde said...
> I have a test case class with 2 methods in it.
> In one test method I initialize a private member variable.
> In the other I try to use it.

> However, the 2nd test fails everytime with a NullPointerException.
> I tried putting an assertNotNull at the end of the first test, which
> succeeds. An assertNotNull for the same member variable fails
> at the beginning of the next test method.

> Does junit initialize all member variables to null between tests?
> If so, how can I avoid it? I tried to implement blank setUp() and
> tearDown() methods, but that did not work.

Each test runs in its own instance of your test class, so the second test
runs in a completely different instance of your class hence the NPE. Why
are you setting a variable within one test for use within another test?
That sounds like some test-coupling you probably don't want.

You use setUp() to construct a fixture that is common across all methods
within your test case - this is one way of defining some known object
state(s) that you can then assert within your tests.

Jonathan
